entry.title: Bitcoin Core 0.10.0 released
entry.summary: Bitcoin Core version 0.10.0 has been released with new features and bug fixes. The release was announced on February 16, 2015 by Wladimir. The new version is available for download from the official Bitcoin website at https://bitcoin.org/bin/0.10.0/. This marks a significant update to the software. Users can expect to see improvements in performance, security, and overall functionality. There are several notable changes, including an upgrade of the OpenSSL library to version 1.0.1m, which includes fixes for the Heartbleed bug. Additionally, there is support for multi-wallets, allowing users to manage multiple wallets within the same installation. Other changes include enhancements to the peer-to-peer networking protocol, such as better handling of incoming connections, and improvements to the user interface. A full list of changes and updates can be found on the Bitcoin website.Overall, Bitcoin Core version 0.10.0 represents a significant step forward for the Bitcoin network, improving both its reliability and usability. Users are encouraged to upgrade to this latest version to take advantage of its new features and bug fixes.
